website_summaries.verdict: The Intel Core i3-6100 is a good choice for a budget general purpose PC or as a starting point for a gaming rig.
cons: Integrated graphics performance lags AMD rivals

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: For the price you cannot shake your head at this CPU. Offers great performance in older games when matched with a GTX 950, runs very cool, the stock CPU fan looks undersized but it does a great job of keeping up and with the case open next to me I haven't heard the fan yet. I'm hoping someday to upgrade my system to an i7, but this chip is doing everything I need it to do right now.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Barberino

customer_reviews.title: Best chip for the money
customer_reviews.text: For mid level computing and high level gaming, I am very happy with this chip, I might upgrade to something with some more multitasking capabilities if I need to but this one is great so far, It does get a little choppy when I multitask sometimes but I can play online games and watch streaming services side by side with almost no interference.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great Cost-Performance Ratio
customer_reviews.text: I got this because it's price point to processing speed was among the best that I'd seen. I mostly do single-threaded computing and trailing edge games, so this thing delivers exactly what I need. I rarely get this thing processing so hard that I can hear the fan. I paired this with a respectable NVidia GPU and an SSD, giving me 60 fps on most older games.
customer_reviews.author: Daring Dewback

customer_reviews.title: So far this seems just as good. I know all of the benchmarks show the ...
customer_reviews.text: My last processor was a sandy bridge core i7. So far this seems just as good. I know all of the benchmarks show the sandy bridge i7 being faster but I don't notice any difference for day to day activities. The ipgu hd 530 especially surprised me. It runs the Dolphin Emulator great. If you're looking at a core i3 I would also consider a pentium g4500. It
customer_reviews.author: Grahf

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2 of these for some HTPC builds and they work amazing. very impressed with the i3 under 100 dollar ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for normally. I bought 2 of these for some HTPC builds and they work amazing. very impressed with the i3 under 100 dollar pricetage and performance and spunkiness of the CPU. now don't go thinking this can handle some intense gaming (obviously paired up with a graphics card) or even heavy video editor software. It would definitely be chugging for awhile as it is not an i5 or i7 by any stretch of the imagination. But it is perfect for the budget builds that would do light gaming as well as some video streaming and HTPC style workload.
customer_reviews.author: Andy & Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. I have had no problems with its operation. Please note- it has built-in graphics processor. Unlike the i5 which does not. that is what makes this chip a slightly better value due to not having to spend way more money on a separate graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Yags

customer_reviews.title: Packs a punch and up gradable skylake architecture.
customer_reviews.text: Nice step into a Skylake setup that can be upgraded. I paired this with 16 GB or ram, M.2 drive and a Gigabyte Z170 mini ITX board so when and if I need to drop in a Skylake 6600 I can. I plan on purchasing a GTX 1070 in June too. This chip offers the best price to performance that I could find and still get good enough on board graphics to hold me over until the 1070 is out.
customer_reviews.author: ChemNerd

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: Your going to want to upgrade to a intel i5 not a i3. Thats the best advice i can give for this product. I will say for the price it runs game pretty smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: GoldenGod

customer_reviews.title: Nice Processor
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic processor. Had to watch some videos to get it installed. (That’s because I’m used to AMD.) Not hard to install though and a good value for the money. Used the stock CPU fan and thermal paste that came with it and it is running just fine.
customer_reviews.author: lwen

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great buy for a budget gaming build
customer_reviews.text: Switched from an AMD FX 6300 to this. I was concerned about a performance drop since this has 4 "virtual" cores as opposed to six cores on the AMD. HOWEVER... This runs programs and games a lot faster than the AMD!! There are plenty of benchmarks out there to prove it. Definitely a great buy for a budget gaming build!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great budget cpu for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I knew I wanted an intel cpu but my budget wouldnt allow it so my plan was to get the amd athlon x4 880k for my budget build but as soon as i saw the price dropped for this cpu i quickly got it ans now i'm very glad to say I'm happy with it and im glad i went with this cpu instead of amd, it was a good processor but ik this one it better, very fast cpu and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great budget gaming processor
customer_reviews.text: In case you haven't noticed already, this product is the PROCESSOR ONLY, no stock heatsink + fan. This is perfect if you're planning on using an aftermarket cooling solution.
customer_reviews.author: Kris B.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a small rig I made and so far its handled all games and programs very well. At first i thought it wouldn't be enough to run the latest games but so far its been able to keep up. Its installed on an MSI B150M gaming pro mobo with an asus 960 strix gpu with kingston hyperx fury ddr4 ram. I have it water cooled with a corsair h55. It makes for a small gaming rig but it handles all my needs very well.
customer_reviews.author: Airfire

customer_reviews.title: Amazing processor especially at overclocking
customer_reviews.text: Amazing processor especially at overclocking, but if you plan on buying a GTX 1060, then this does bottleneck the GPU a bit. If I had to make another purchase, I would've bought the i5 6600k. THOUGH the i3 6100 is still amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: but I still love it. The integrated graphics served me well for ...
customer_reviews.text: Obsolete and Overpriced now with the g4560 series pentiums/Ryzen 1200/1300x available, but I still love it. The integrated graphics served me well for many months until I bought a graphics card. I plan to upgrade to i7-7700 years down the road. It's been Perfect for day to day use, work, and light gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Tho Pho

customer_reviews.title: The i3 continues to prove to be the power house of budget systems!
customer_reviews.text: I built a new PC with this, with a MSI H110 LGA 1151 motherboard, 8GB of DDR4 2133 mh RAM, and running Ubuntu Mate Linux. So fast and responsive. You don't have to spend a lot to get great performance anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Tenchidbz

customer_reviews.title: Power for Price
customer_reviews.text: Threw this in a micro-ATX with a GTX1070. Handled every game I threw at it. If you're not beating the crap out of the CPU then why look any further than an i3?
customer_reviews.author: Messageman87

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for moderate gaming and moderate editing.
customer_reviews.text: It can run all Adobe products well, runs 3D modeling in Inventor well. Can render videos well. Great budget product. Runs games extremely well. Only fallback is the fan it comes with, it's a little loud and the heatsink doesn't work as well as I would like. While playing Overwatch with mostly Ultra settings it gets 60fps solid so it's a pretty good budget build CPU that I would recommend. Also since it's a LGA 1151 it can be upgraded to a quad core i7.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice little CPU
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little CPU, if you are just going to game or run light programs it's ideal, especially if you are unable to stretch your budget. I, however, managed to get a hold of some extra cash and replaced it with an Intel Core i5-7500.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a budget PC for my kids. Installed it with an SSD and 8GB Ram. Works better than I expected. They use it for browser games and Minecraft. Even without a video card it works perfect for both. My kids are thrilled to have their own own PC that outperforms their dads laptop with an older i5. Would buy again in a heartbeat if I need to build another budget PC.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: awesome. for most people anything else is overkill.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to complain about with this baby. Super fast, cheap, and paired with my GPU card can handle all the games I play so far, mostly world of warships maxed out( didn't know the mountains had trees on them :) It is an awesome and cheap CPU. Figure out your needs and budget, for casual gamers and everyday use( besides art design, Photoshop etc), anything other than this would be overkill. and for the price, and being Intel, you can`t complain.
customer_reviews.author: G. Terrero

customer_reviews.title: best budget minded first choice i know
customer_reviews.text: cheap price for newest architecture, very high clock. this sucker is brilliant for 1080p gaming and can even do higher resolutions pretty damn well for battlefield given you pair it with right gpu. 4k video rendering is spectacular with seperately purchased h60 water cooler or 212 evo fan. best starter cpu for my intel conversion.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: This cpu was a great bang for the buck buy
customer_reviews.text: This cpu was a great bang for the buck buy. It gives you access to skylake which gives you access to 100 series mobos and ddr4. It Handel's well and under load I've only seen Temps reach 55 ONCE. Powerful enough for gaming and even programming. A great buy, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: This nifty dual-core with Hyperthreading is a breath of fresh air over my older Pentium Dual-Core. Paired this up on a Asus B250M-A motherboard as a media server and the two work great together. On board graphics is sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Hikasbit

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price for a normal usage PC Build
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a NEW PC build for my sister and since she only uses the computer for bills and surfing online I felt any higher chip would be a waste and any lower might be handicapping. And yet it still might have been overkill for what she does. But it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: T. Reive

customer_reviews.title: Very Good CPU
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice processor which I used in my recent budget build. The integrated graphics play many light games such as Minecraft at around 40-60 fps on very high settings. The included cpu cooler fan and heat sink get the job done for cooling the cpu if you are not planning to do any overclocking. Overall, this is a very nice cpu for the price and would definitely recommend it for anyone looking to build a great gaming pc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You don't need a $1000 dollar build to enjoy the newest titles anymore
customer_reviews.text: PC gaming is so cheap these days. You don't need a $1000 dollar build to enjoy the newest titles anymore. I bought one of these budget CPUs for my brother's rig and he can play anything he wants with high settings. You can put together a pc with one of these plus a gtx 950 for $500 (minus OS) and get great results. (I used a hand-me-down r9 280 in his build).
customer_reviews.author: That girl with the face

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: This is THE budget gaming CPU. Forget the fx 6300, or even the more exspensive 8300 series. This beats both those processors in HUGE ways. I've used this in two builds now. One not exceeding 450$ and being able to max games like GTA V. Perfect CPU don't look anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Price/performance ration good.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bargain if you want a fast (3.7Mhz) chip and don't need a lot of cores (only 2). For Lightroom that's what you want. I am using it with an m.2 SSD mounted on a PCI adapter and the whole thing screams.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G. Bragg Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Single core beast.
customer_reviews.text: While not as proficient at multicore as it's bigger Skylake siblings(this bad boy is only dual core), this little guy is still a monster. Cheap and powerful. Performs surprisingly well as a mid level entry gaming cpu.
customer_reviews.author: tayler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: It was really good before I finally sold it for an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: CLEM O.

customer_reviews.title: Great processor for budget builds!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great processor! Great for budget builds or any builds that aren't super process heavy. If you're a heavy user, you should probably look at an i5 or i7 in the Skylake family. Pairs well with a 970. Anything more and you may as well splurge for an i5.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Braziel

customer_reviews.title: It is the latest and greatest from Intel
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a CHAMP. I purchased this for my wife's budget build. I have 0 complaints with this guy. It is the latest and greatest from Intel. DDR4 support. 2 cores + hyperthreading. Great price. Stick with Intel, they are the kings of CPU's
customer_reviews.author: Kyle STop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Price/Performance value!
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the first one because it wasn't working on arrival, but the replacement is working fantastically in my new system. Have not had any issues so far and it is staying cool and fast with the stock cooler. Couldn't ask for more for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It may not be the best CPU for gaming, but his little guy is an impressive monster.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: suppper item !!
customer_reviews.text: it was super item, i was thinking if it was good for gaming , but i can say: yes , absolutely. i ordered this cpu after very long time of thinking, it was shipped very fast, delievered fast and i got great item , i was very happy for this item , thanks to seller.
customer_reviews.author: luka akhvlediani

customer_reviews.title: The price was great and the computer is quite snappy with plenty of ...
customer_reviews.text: Used in a home office build. The price was great and the computer is quite snappy with plenty of RAM and a SSD. No complaints. Using the internal GPU it plays the likes of Minecraft as well as some less demanding computer games. We're really pleased with this CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrewings

customer_reviews.title: As always Intel is great.
customer_reviews.text: For my application it is massively underutilized 99% of the time. But the machine boots up amazingly fast. Typical intel awesomeness.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic Dog

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product and the company very costumer friendly ...
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product and the company very costumer friendly product was delivered promptly and with no problem. Will recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a simple office desktop.
customer_reviews.text: Intel's Intel. Is it not cheap? No. Is it stable and reliable for years and years? Yes. I bought this upgrading my dad's office desktop. A computer to write documents and share multimedia files, capable of smooth HD playback.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey

customer_reviews.title: I love this CPU
customer_reviews.text: An i7 is a lion , but let me tell you something. This i3 is a little damn cheetah when it comes to doing things. Don't underestimate this baby. She can run Arma 3 on all high settings while getting 50-60 FPS, without over clocking. I love this CPU, I really do & if you are ok a budget this thing is the best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: basedgod

customer_reviews.title: New Computer
customer_reviews.text: I finally had all the parts to put together my new computer. Starting with the ASrock motherboard, Intel core I3-6100, Crucial 8gb ddr4 2133 mt memory, EVGA 430 w1 80+ power supply and Samsung 850 EVO 250gb drive. Every thing went together very well and is running great. As always shipment arrived on time if not sooner.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: ... low power cpu for quiet media center built works great. My previous build was an AMD CPU/GPU combo ...
customer_reviews.text: Wanted low power cpu for quiet media center built works great. My previous build was an AMD CPU/GPU combo and I could never get the hardware acceleration working with Linux for decoding x264 videos -- i had no trouble getting the onboard graphics working with VAAPI in Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn O

customer_reviews.title: ... a integrated video card on the cpu cpu runs good for a dual processor
customer_reviews.text: It's graphics surpassed my expectations for a integrated video card on the cpu cpu runs good for a dual processor
customer_reviews.author: Lillie

customer_reviews.title: The best for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Its really fast, comes in an easy opening packaging and with the best installing method for the Cooler. Plus, it uses contact points instead of pins like some AMD, which protects you for damaging the processor. Add DDR4 and an SD and you'll have one of the fastes pcs for every task.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and with the hyperthreading is acts just like a quad-core
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fast processor, and with the hyperthreading is acts just like a quad-core. For a sub 130 processor this cannot be beat. Paired with a SSD everything is instant, no wait times for anything whatsoever. I plan on using this in other builds.
customer_reviews.author: stacj

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home PC build looking to stay on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Great budget processor! Runs nice and cool. Average processor temp is about 27 Celsius. Built a new home pc with this, the ASUS Z170M-PLUS Micro ATX and 16 GB of Corsair RAM and using a left over GTX 750ti. Also my first SSD. Couldn't be more happier with the processor.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Jones

customer_reviews.title: Intel does it again.
customer_reviews.text: Another great product by Intel.I used this to build a price performance PC for my girlfriend, and she loves it. Skylakes processors are far more efficient than the older models, and the price for performance on this i3 s very high. Unless you are a power user, with video editing, and heavy gaming with the newest titles this is probably the best processor to buy.
customer_reviews.author: John Hardy

customer_reviews.title: This is a snappy little thing. It's essentially a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a snappy little thing. It's essentially a quad core because of the hyper threading, and can still run most games as long as it's paired with an appropriate gpu.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M.

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Fast enough for my standard processing. I don't typically do anything very intensive, just browsing, word processing, and occasional photoshop. I haven't had any delays with this processor so far, or any issues setting it up with Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Fot the mechanically inclined
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my grandson, who was making a home computer for gaming. This unit fit the bill and performs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Joe No

customer_reviews.title: Great processor
customer_reviews.text: Brilliantly fast processor. Works as it should. Got this planning to upgrade to an i7 at some point but not really sure if I need to. The performance is more than needed for anything I throw at it
customer_reviews.author: mars198

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had a problem yet
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a problem yet but I got a two year extended warranty just in case. Came in handy when my hard drive went out got my money back no questions asked. SquareTrade was great.
customer_reviews.author: stressed61614

customer_reviews.title: Awesome CPU for the price
customer_reviews.text: Way better than my old Intel CPU that was in a so called gaming computer built by (CyberPower) with the lowest cheapest Intel chip you can buy. I love this i3 and it's performance overall in gaming!
customer_reviews.author: Terry E. Long Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Ran Witcher 3 @4K, enough said.
customer_reviews.text: yes, I understand an i5 or i7 are faster and stronger. However, for many people that would be overkill. This runs just about anything you can throw at it. paired with an RX 480 it ran Witcher 3 @4K on high settings. Honestly would have loved to pair it with a better card to see how it performed. but for about $100, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Works well and was a good deal
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Works well and was a good deal. Comes with stock fan which is good enough for regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Best CPU for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Intel is the way to go. This product performs great for casual gaming, and runs triple A titles! It also renders video much faster than my AMD processor.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa A. Gingrich

customer_reviews.title: One of the best budget CPU's out there
customer_reviews.text: The I3-6100 is good for normal gaming, just don't expect to video edit efficiently on this. However, if you're looking to do everyday tasks and do some 1080p gaming (with a GPU of course) it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: ... this for many rigs and can't lie its the best thing
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for many rigs and can't lie its the best thing
customer_reviews.author: Insidious Cloud

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed at the performance gain from this bargain CPU
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to install on amotherboard. Coming from a 10 year old PC, I was amazed at the performance gain from this bargain CPU. All you need for a basic PC.
customer_reviews.author: Aussiedicky

customer_reviews.title: Great processor
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little processor for the money! Put it in my mother-in-laws PC, it works great and she has had no issues with it at all. Has been working for about a year with no problems, runs cool and fast for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Thor

customer_reviews.title: Value Buy
customer_reviews.text: Best processor for home use. Hands down a must buy for office use. Price to performance ratio is the best for its class and it is technically better than an i5 in office tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony A.

customer_reviews.title: Great processor for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I build a PC about 4 years ago with this for gaming purposes and it’s still working great to this day. It is a little outdated. Great for light gaming/office pc.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Well while this is a good CPU should have purchased the I5 6600
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to build a streaming(4K) rig with 8 gigs of RAM. Well while this is a good CPU should have purchased the I5 6600 . Have a build with the I5 , 8 gigs of RAM and it chews thru 4K MUCH better. So for video spend the extra $80 approx for a better experience.
customer_reviews.author: MP1977

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, installed well, didn't need an after market fan.
customer_reviews.author: terster

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang for your Buck!
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a new system build. I Have been very happy with it. will upgrade to i5 or i7 at some point. But this is doing everything I need it to. Does not support Overclocking.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Jennings

customer_reviews.title: nearly as good as the i5 6500 we are using in our ...
customer_reviews.text: Chip works really well, nearly as good as the i5 6500 we are using in our other system. Included fan comes RTU with thermal paste and clips right in.
customer_reviews.author: John Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking
customer_reviews.text: As of September 2016, if you want a solid budget cpu for a home pc, stop looking. This is it. This is the best single core performance you're going to get within $50 of this price range. Product worked as expected. I have no other advice to give. Visit logicalincrements for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor
customer_reviews.text: No issues with the product at all. Replaced the motherboard and processor of a cheap desktop I snagged a few years ago and everything runs a lot better. Benchmark scores went up 3k and games loaded much better. Stock fan is fine as is and temps have been very stable. Would recommend for a budget budget gaming machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Gaming
customer_reviews.text: Runs fantastic, was debating on going with a i5-6500 but after looking at reviews for gaming and performance the i5-6500 would have been overkill for gaming. The new 6th generation Intel Skylake Processors are amazing, pair this with a good GPU and a SSD and never look back.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, is by far the best processor under $ 180
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good first processor I've used.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely good quality. Easy to install. Played gta 5 very well with onboard graphics. Then I got a thx 1050 ti with it. A God pc
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my budget build, able to handle my general tasks and light gaming with ease
customer_reviews.author: Austin K.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing procesor, works great
customer_reviews.text: a Little Beast, i can do games better than my old build it was an FX-8300 with 8GB of Ram and R9 290X 4Gb, with this processor, i was using an old gtx 2GB, and is running amazing, i can max out pretty much every game, some other 1080P, this processor is great for budget gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremias Nunez Pozo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Built a computer with one of these. It's served me well for the last couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great processor
customer_reviews.text: Fast, quiet and cheap makes this a great choice. I also have an AMD build and this is so quiet in comparison, its unreal. Paired with a GTX 950 and it's been great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. No issues to report
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. No issues to report. Working great with a gtx 1050ti gpu running halo wars 2 right now and smooth sailing at 1080p.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... computer from scratch and it turned out to be AWESOME.
customer_reviews.text: I bouth this item along with other stuff to build an entire gaming computer from scratch and it turned out to be AWESOME.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ruiz Daker

customer_reviews.title: you can easily run SC2
customer_reviews.text: More than enough for most e-sports games. With a 750ti or 950, you can easily run SC2, LoL, Overwatch maxed.
customer_reviews.author: Jae C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Budget Gaming Rig
customer_reviews.text: Great processor for a budget gaming rig. Also, can always upgrade to an i5 or i7 down the road...
customer_reviews.author: dunng

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Intel processors are the best most stable and reliable processors
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best budget processor period
customer_reviews.text: This processor is actually faster than a mid range 4th gen i5, it's perfect for a budget gaming build. I use it to extract over 60fps from games running at 1080p to my HDTV when paired with an Nvidia 970. Should work nicely for the next few years.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Harris

customer_reviews.title: I went with this instead of i5/i7 processors. My ...
customer_reviews.text: I went with this instead of i5/i7 processors. My build was purely for gaming so processor being i3 has not affected my needs yet. It will hold up!
customer_reviews.author: jlee

customer_reviews.title: Good chip for the price
customer_reviews.text: Working well in an Asus mini-ITX motherboard with Intel low-profile cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H.

customer_reviews.title: Good value processor
customer_reviews.text: Its a processor, over priced because Intel can but it does the job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the $
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the $. Works great in new build to run Aces High WW2 flight sim, along with GTX 1060 runs graphics set full on at 60 fps on 1080 p monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bukantis

customer_reviews.title: For ~110$ this sure is a great processor.
customer_reviews.text: I went from an i7-2700k to this i3-6100 expecting a huge performance drop. I was pleasantly surprised. For ~110$ this sure is a great processor.
customer_reviews.author: Aidin McLaurin

customer_reviews.title: Really love this CPU
customer_reviews.text: Really love this CPU. For the price it is a fantastic processor. Equipped next to a SSD , 8 GB of RAM and Linux this is a great CPU
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming cpu
customer_reviews.text: If you want a gaming pc that wont break the bank I3 are the best. It will match a i5 in any game you throw at it.

customer_reviews.title: at just over 100$ is perhaps the best processor on the market for this price range
customer_reviews.text: This processor, at just over 100$ is perhaps the best processor on the market for this price range. I am running the newest games with very little effort and no overclocking.
customer_reviews.author: S. Falls

customer_reviews.title: Good budget processor.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this processor for about three years, and while it's a great processor for the price, there's better ones out there.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent CPU. I think its a sweet spot for ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent CPU. I think its a sweet spot for office/gaming PC. Runs very cool and works great with my GTX 960

customer_reviews.text: This processor is pretty powerful. I can't imagine the power of an i5 or i7, as this i3 is probably enough for most.

product_meta.title: Intel BX80662I36100 Intel Core i3 6100 Skylake Dual-Core 3.7 GHz Processor
product_meta.description:
Style Name:ProcessorProduct Description

Revolution in the mini- PC world , the new Intel NUC Skylake still has more functions into even finer housing. This ultra- compact and scalable solution with Intel Core i3 processor provides a customizable engine suitable for small spaces and for every application you can imagine ( home cinema, multimedia center and intelligent systems ) . The NUC Intel NUC6I3SYH embarks including four USB 3.0 ports, an infrared sensor , a headphone / microphone jack , HDMI video interfaces 1.4b and Mini DisplayPort for various personal or professional use . Discover a world of possibilities with this powerful , compact machine. Even more incredible that our technology is the use you make of it.
